node.text:
The @911memorial & Museum Visionary Network is ensuring the next generation never forgets the lives lost, the sacrifices made, and the ongoing consequences of that day. 

It’s an important mission—one I am glad to support. If you're between the ages of 21 and 45 and want to deepen your connection to the 9/11 Memorial & Museum and ensure that future generations remember 9/11 and its aftermath, join the Visionary Network at the link in bio.

node.text:
In response to the greatest challenge to public education in generations, the Biden administration needs to get kids back in the classroom without delay—and push states to run universal summer school.

For our kids, and our future, there is nothing more important. Read why at my link in bio.

node.title: Pandemic Recovery Should Include Summer School

node.text: Many would like to forget that 2020 happened—but there’s never been a year more important to learn from. In @BloombergDotOrg's Annual Report, I write about how our response to 2020’s crises can prepare us to build a stronger future for generations to come. Read my letter at the link in bio.

node.title: Mike Bloomberg’s Annual Letter on Philanthropy

node.text: Cities around the world are leading the way on ambitious solutions to COVID-19 and recovery, rebuilding local economies, addressing social injustice, and advancing climate goals -- and mayors convened to discuss promising solutions at #CityLab2021.

node.text:
When there’s a crisis, the public needs to be able to trust its leaders. 

How we build that trust in an age of disinformation — to end this pandemic and prevent the next one—is the topic of this #CityLab2021 discussion with @drvivekmurthy, @rasjbaraka, Dr. Kelly Henning, and @miabirdsong.

node.title: Trust & Resilience in the Age of COVID-19

node.text:
The challenges facing mayors are large -- and strengthening and diversifying local leadership across the country is critical to getting more big things done. 

We were proud to announce two new investments at @Harvard and @NYUniversity to do just that at #CityLab2021.

node.title: Mike Bloomberg Announces Investments at Harvard & NYU

At #CityLab2021, we were glad to welcome the man formerly known as Mayor Pete, now @SecretaryPete: Pete Buttigieg. 

Watch Mayor-Turned-Secretary Pete and @citylab reporter Laura Bliss discuss what Build Back Better means for American cities.

node.text:
@BloombergDotOrg’s #AsphaltArt projects can help cities rebuild from the pandemic by making streets safer & more vibrant. 

U.S. cities can now apply for grants of up to $25K towards projects that use art & design to improve street safety and revitalize public spaces at AsphaltArt.Bloomberg.Org.

node.title: Expanding Asphalt Art to More Cities

node.text: @john.cranley, Mayor of Cincinnati, OH, gets it: Strategic climate investments can be better for the environment and for city budgets. A winner of the American Cities Climate Challenge, he explains how the Green Cincinnati Plan is making a difference.

node.title: A Carbon-Free Future in Cincinnati, OH

node.text: The question isn't if we'll face another pandemic; the question is when. Read my latest @bloombergopinion op-ed at my link in bio.

node.title: How to Prepare for the Next Pandemic

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Mike Bloomberg in New York, New York. May be an image of 2 people, people sitting and indoor.

node.text:
@antonioguterres has galvanized the world to take action in the fight against climate change. But the reality is, the problem is getting worse. To respond with the urgency that’s required, we all need to do more. 

G20 members have an opportunity to lead the way - and it was great meeting with the G20 ambassadors to discuss how to do just that before @cop26uk.

node.text:
The @911memorial & Museum Visionary Network is ensuring the next generation never forgets the lives lost, the sacrifices made, and the ongoing consequences of that day. 

It’s an important mission—one I am glad to support. If you're between the ages of 21 and 45 and want to deepen your connection to the 9/11 Memorial & Museum and ensure that future generations remember 9/11 and its aftermath, join the Visionary Network at the link in bio.

3.5 million people commute into Buenos Aires, Argentina every day - making #roadsafety a critical priority for Mayor @horaciorodriguezlarreta. 

The city has curbed drunk driving and invested in road infrastructure to reduce speeding through the @WHO and @VitalStrategies Partnership for Healthy Cities. Learn more about the initiative:

node.text:
The Dominican Republic has the highest road traffic mortality rate in the area. Santo Domingo Mayor @carolinamejiagomez is working to make her city easier to get around, and safer for cyclists.
 
In 2017, the city implemented the Bicycle Action Plan, a pilot through our Partnership for Healthy Cities initiative - a collaboration between @bloombergdotorg, @who and @vitalstrategies - that increased road safety and reduced the amount of deaths and injuries. Hear from Mayor Carolina Mejía what this program has meant to residents:

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Mike Bloomberg in Johns Hopkins University. May be a black-and-white image of 1 person.

node.text:
I was an average student in college — because I found what I really liked was outside of the classroom. Through campus activities, I learned about organizing events, getting people to work together, building consensus, and leading groups. It was a great education that I put to use when I got my first full-time job, when I started a company, and when I became mayor. 
 
Good luck to the millions of college students who will step on campus and get involved in activities for the first time in more than a year. There is power in being together - not only for college students, but for younger kids, too. I wrote about the importance of opening all schools, five days a week, in a recent op-ed for @BloombergOpinion. Read it at the link in bio.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Mike Bloomberg on August 11, 2021. May be an image of 5 people, people standing and suit.

node.text: It's a new day for New York. @ltgovhochulny’s pragmatic leadership style will help her get things done - and her experience in local government will serve her well. Rooting for her and wishing her the best at this critical moment in our state’s recovery.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Mike Bloomberg on August 09, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'Opening Schools Should Be Priority No. The pandemic has done immense harm to students. Getting kids back to class should top everyone's agenda. By Michael R. Bloomberg August 9, 2021, 5:00 AM EDT'.

node.text: Getting kids back in the classroom must be a society-wide priority. America’s children cannot afford a replay of last year. Read my @bloombergopinion op-ed at link in bio.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Mike Bloomberg in Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic. May be an image of 4 people and people standing.

node.text: Merengue king - and mayor - Johnny Ventura was a legend whose music and public service both reflected his love of the Dominican Republic. It was an honor to be presented with the Key to the City by him in Santo Domingo, and a pleasure to meet with him. His legacy will be felt - and heard and danced to - for generations.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Mike Bloomberg on July 21, 2021. May be an image of 2 people, people standing, people sitting, suit and indoor.

node.text:
Always glad to spend time with Prime Minister @sanchezcastejon—a leader who understands that fighting climate change won't only save our planet. It will also save lives.

Siempre un placer reunirme con el presidente @sanchezcastejon -- un líder que entiende que luchar contra el cambio climático no sólo salvará el planeta. También salvará vidas.

node.text:
Winning the fight against climate change requires urgent & bold action, and we need ​G-20 governments to lead the way.

@bloombergdotorg and @bloombergnef's report highlights immediate government action needed to build a resilient, sustainable global economy. Learn more at my link in bio.

node.text:
City governments worked quickly to reconfigure data and digital services during the pandemic - and it's time to build on those gains more inclusively. 
 
I'm glad to share that @BloombergDotOrg will be working with six mayors and cities - @mayor_bowser of Washington, DC; Mayor @londonbreed of San Francisco, California; Mayor @burgemeesterfemkehalsema of @gemeenteamsterdam; Mayor @daguregg of @reykjavikurborg; Mayor @claudialopezcl of @alcaldiabogota; and Mayor @claudia_shein of Mexico City, Mexico - to supercharge their work to bring city services into the digital age, deliver better results for residents, and share lessons with other cities around the world. 
 
Learn more about the program at the link in my bio.
